channel.title: Comments on: Spinach and Sour Cream Dip

item.title: By: Michelle De Rooy
item.dc:creator: Michelle De Rooy
item.description: This is wonderful. It is so good, I have included it as part of my Easy Christmas menu on my blog on Christmas meals made easy. Thank you. http://robbiebago.blogspot.com.au/2012/12/christmas-food-made-easy.html
item.content:encoded:
This is wonderful. It is so good, I have included it as part of my Easy Christmas menu on my blog on Christmas meals made easy. Thank you.
http://robbiebago.blogspot.com.au/2012/12/christmas-food-made-easy.html

item.title: By: Tanya
item.dc:creator: Tanya
item.description: I love this dip. I make it all the time its the only way to get my 4 young children to eat spinach. However my recipe is different I've never added cheese. Yours is the first where I've seen it in the list of ingredients. Next time I'll give it ago . Maybe it will make the perfect dip even better ;)
item.content:encoded: I love this dip. I make it all the time its the only way to get my 4 young children to eat spinach. However my recipe is different I’ve never added cheese. Yours is the first where I’ve seen it in the list of ingredients. Next time I’ll give it ago . Maybe it will make the perfect dip even better ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: susie
item.dc:creator: susie
item.description: I add some sliced watered crestnuts (from a can)...it just gives it some crunch. This is one of those dips that EVERYONE asks 'can i have the receipe'..lol
item.content:encoded: I add some sliced watered crestnuts (from a can)…it just gives it some crunch. This is one of those dips that EVERYONE asks ‘can i have the receipe’..lol

item.title: By: betty
item.dc:creator: betty
item.description: yours looks GREAT!!! what a great idea to over fill them when i made mine i had abit less dip then bread :P
item.content:encoded: yours looks GREAT!!! what a great idea to over fill them when i made mine i had abit less dip then bread ðŸ˜›

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/spinach-and-sour-cream-dip/comment-page-1/#comment-2229">Sarah</a>.
Hey Sarah I'm really not sure of the origin of this dip - all I know is it's loved at most parties I go to (and it's not me making it most of the time). Just had a quick check for any info about the origin - but no luck. I'd love to find out if anyone knows the answer :) Thanks Anita
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sarah.

Hey Sarah
I’m really not sure of the origin of this dip – all I know is it’s loved at most parties I go to (and it’s not me making it most of the time).
Just had a quick check for any info about the origin – but no luck. I’d love to find out if anyone knows the answer ðŸ™‚
Thanks
Anita

item.title: By: Sarah
item.dc:creator: Sarah
item.description:
I made this for an afternoon tea yesterday and it was a hit. I used light sour cream (as it was a girly affair!) which worked well. Am also keen to try this recipe with mozarella instead of tasty cheese.
PLUS, two friends commented that it was similar to a dip that they had had as part of Jewish and Sri Lankan meals. Do you know what the origin of the dip is?
item.content:encoded:
I made this for an afternoon tea yesterday and it was a hit. I used light sour cream (as it was a girly affair!) which worked well. Am also keen to try this recipe with mozarella instead of tasty cheese.

PLUS, two friends commented that it was similar to a dip that they had had as part of Jewish and Sri Lankan meals. Do you know what the origin of the dip is?

item.title: By: Barbara
item.dc:creator: Barbara
item.description: Can't wait to hear about your French cake cooking class! I love this dip served in the bread bowl. Going to remember it for football Sundays!
item.content:encoded:
Can’t wait to hear about your French cake cooking class!
I love this dip served in the bread bowl. Going to remember it for football Sundays!

item.title: By: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.dc:creator: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.description: Do-ahead dishes are great, and this sounds yummy. Going to Melbourne for a cake course sounds really exciting!
item.content:encoded: Do-ahead dishes are great, and this sounds yummy. Going to Melbourne for a cake course sounds really exciting!

item.title: By: Ellie

item.description: Yummy dip! Love how you serve it on the cob :)
item.content:encoded: Yummy dip! Love how you serve it on the cob ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Jeanne
item.dc:creator: Jeanne
item.description: Looks delicious! Spinach is one of those vegetables that doesn't usually sound good to me, but I always enjoy it when it's in a dip like this!
item.content:encoded: Looks delicious! Spinach is one of those vegetables that doesn’t usually sound good to me, but I always enjoy it when it’s in a dip like this!
